title: Serotonin
text: Produced in the raphe nuclei located mainly in the pons and medulla parts of the brainstem, serotonin influences mood, sleep regulation, and pain perception.

title: Dopamine
text: Originates from the substantia nigra and ventral tegmental area in the midbrain, dopamine plays a key role in motivation, reward, and motor control.

title: Norepinephrine
text: Made in the locus coeruleus in the pons part of the brainstem, norepinephrine increases alertness, arousal, and helps regulate heart rate.

title: Acetylcholine
text: Produced in several brainstem nuclei including the reticular formation, mainly within the pons and midbrain, acetylcholine regulates REM sleep, arousal, and muscle control.

title: Glutamate
text: A major excitatory neurotransmitter throughout the brainstem (midbrain, pons, and medulla), glutamate facilitates neural activation and signal transmission.

title: GABA
text: The primary inhibitory neurotransmitter in the brainstem, GABA helps reduce overactivity and promote calm within circuits across the midbrain, pons, and medulla.
